title: Durand Line
summary: The Durand Line (Pashto: د ډیورنډ کرښه‎; Urdu: ڈیورنڈ لائن‎) forms the Afghanistan–Pakistan border, a 2,670-kilometre (1,660 mi) international land border between the countries of Afghanistan and Pakistan in South Asia.[1] The western end runs to the border with Iran and the eastern end to the border with China.
